basic_info.description: Iâ€™ve been working within the health and wellness industry for 7+ years, wearing many hats that have included leadership roles, marketing strategy, sales, branding, and more. I have a tract record of being a key contributor in a team setting and exceeding expectations. Given my background and skill sets, I am pivoting my career focus to software engineering, to leverage my career path in an industry that has proven time and again its value in being an essential component to business and society.

projects.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
projects.description: Tic-Tac-Toe was my first solo project that was created through HTML, CSS, and javaScript. Establishing all of the correct logics for a 'draw' or a 'win' and manipulating the displays was tough, but rewarding!

projects.title: What the Truck?
projects.description: This project replicates the classic board game 'Traffic Jam'. The car pieces are rendered to the playing board on the grid and manipulated through drag and drop methods. I really enjoyed the complexity of this DOM manipulation project

projects.title: Fantasy Dragball
projects.description: This was a personal favorite project for me; where I could apply my knowledge to a passion of mine, which is drag. Data about queens were rendered through an API. Data was stored in a local DB where a logged in user can create their own favorites list and draft a team of queens. I'd love to create a high-scale, live-updated version of this!

projects.title: Cat Collector
projects.description: This is a full CRUD, user authenticated, multiple document app made with Python & Django. Although simple in design, it represents a quick translation of a new language to a high and multi-functioning app!

projects.title: Check My Fit
projects.description: Check My Fit is a social media site where a user can see an index, or feed, of uploaded outfits, rate them as 'hot' or 'not' & leave a comment, as well as upload their own outfits. Views can be indexed by the user or searched by the # associated with looks. This was a great, fun way to show of many documents and subdocs in a many-to-many relationship.
